trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Evidence.com | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Evidence.com | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Evidence.com.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and Evidence.com.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Evidence.com
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Evidence.com

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory (AAD) and Evidence.com.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory (AAD) and Evidence.com.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Microsoft Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Microsoft Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Evidence.com subscription with single sign On enabled (email earlyaccess@evidence.com if SAML-based single sign on is not enabled)
trans-unit.target: An Evidence.com subscription with single sign On enabled (email earlyaccess@evidence.com if SAML-based single sign on is not enabled)

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assigned Evidence.com access will be able to single sign into the application using the AAD Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the AAD users to whom you have assigned Evidence.com access will be able to single sign into the application using the AAD Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: Add Evidence.com to your directory
trans-unit.target: Add Evidence.com to your directory

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to add Evidence.com as an integrated application in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to add Evidence.com as an integrated application in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Evidence:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Evidence:

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: To open the Application Gallery, click **Add**, and then click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: To open the Application Gallery, click **Add**, and then click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type **Evidence.com**.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type **Evidence.com**.

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Evidence.com**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Evidence.com**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Evidence.com with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to Evidence.com with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: After adding Evidence.com in the Azure classic portal, click **Configure Single Sign-On**.
trans-unit.target: After adding Evidence.com in the Azure classic portal, click **Configure Single Sign-On**.

trans-unit.source: On the next screen, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the next screen, select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure App URL screen, enter the URL where users will sign into your Evidence.com tenant URL (Example: https://yourtenant.evidence.com and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure App URL screen, enter the URL where users will sign into your Evidence.com tenant URL (Example: https://yourtenant.evidence.com and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Download Certificate** link, and save it to your local drive.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Download Certificate** link, and save it to your local drive.

trans-unit.source: This certificate and the metadata URLs ( Entity ID, SSO Sign In URL and Sign Out URL ) will be used to set up SSO on Evidence.com site.
trans-unit.target: This certificate and the metadata URLs ( Entity ID, SSO Sign In URL and Sign Out URL ) will be used to set up SSO on Evidence.com site.

trans-unit.source: In a separate web browser window, login to your Evidence.com tenant as an administrator and navigate to **Admin** Tab
trans-unit.target: In a separate web browser window, login to your Evidence.com tenant as an administrator and navigate to **Admin** Tab

trans-unit.source: Click on **Agency Single Sign On**
trans-unit.target: Click on **Agency Single Sign On**

trans-unit.source: Select **SAML Based Single Sign On**
trans-unit.target: Select **SAML Based Single Sign On**

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Issuer URL**, **Single Sign On** and **Single Sign Out** values shown in the Azure classic portal and to the corresponding fields in Evidence.com.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Issuer URL**, **Single Sign On** and **Single Sign Out** values shown in the Azure classic portal and to the corresponding fields in Evidence.com.

trans-unit.source: Open the certificate downloaded in step 4 using a text editor like Notepad.exe, and copy and paste the contents into the **Security Certificate** box.
trans-unit.target: Open the certificate downloaded in step 4 using a text editor like Notepad.exe, and copy and paste the contents into the **Security Certificate** box.

trans-unit.source: Save the configuration in Evidence.com.
trans-unit.target: Save the configuration in Evidence.com.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure classic portal, check **Confirm that you have configured single sign-on as described above**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure classic portal, check **Confirm that you have configured single sign-on as described above**.

trans-unit.source: Checking this will enable the current certificate to start working for this application checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Checking this will enable the current certificate to start working for this application checkbox.

trans-unit.source: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: Creating an Evidence.com test user
trans-unit.target: Creating an Evidence.com test user

trans-unit.source: For Azure AD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned for access inside the Evidence.com application.
trans-unit.target: For Azure AD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned for access inside the Evidence.com application.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create Azure AD user accounts inside Evidence.com
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create Azure AD user accounts inside Evidence.com

trans-unit.source: To provision a user account in Evidence.com:
trans-unit.target: To provision a user account in Evidence.com:

trans-unit.source: In a web browser window, log into your Evidence.com company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a web browser window, log into your Evidence.com company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Admin** tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Admin** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Add User**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Add User**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: The **Email Address** of the added user must match the username of the users in Azure AD who you wish to give access.
trans-unit.target: The **Email Address** of the added user must match the username of the users in Azure AD who you wish to give access.

trans-unit.source: If the username and email address are not the same value in your organization, you can use the **Evidence.com > Attributes > Single Sign-On** section of the Azure classic portal to change the nameidenitifer sent to Evidence.com to be the email address.
trans-unit.target: If the username and email address are not the same value in your organization, you can use the **Evidence.com > Attributes > Single Sign-On** section of the Azure classic portal to change the nameidenitifer sent to Evidence.com to be the email address.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users to Evidence.com
trans-unit.target: Assigning users to Evidence.com

trans-unit.source: For provisioned AAD users to be able to see Evidence.com on their Access Panel, they must be assigned access inside the Azure classic portal.
trans-unit.target: For provisioned AAD users to be able to see Evidence.com on their Access Panel, they must be assigned access inside the Azure classic portal.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Evidence.com:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Evidence.com:

trans-unit.source: On the quick start page for Evidence.com in the Azure classic portal, click **Assign users to Evidence.com**.
trans-unit.target: On the quick start page for Evidence.com in the Azure classic portal, click **Assign users to Evidence.com**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Show** menu, select whether you want to assign a user or a group to Evidence.com, and click the Checkmark button.
trans-unit.target: In the **Show** menu, select whether you want to assign a user or a group to Evidence.com, and click the Checkmark button.

trans-unit.source: In the **Users** list, select the users to group to whom you want to assign Evidence.com.
trans-unit.target: In the **Users** list, select the users to group to whom you want to assign Evidence.com.

trans-unit.source: In the page footer, click the **Assign** button.
trans-unit.target: In the page footer, click the **Assign** button.
